page.title: 07FARMING 2
page.content: IN BARRY THERE ARE TWO INTENSIVE UNITS.ONE CHICKEN FARM PRODUCES EGGS, THE OTHER PRODUCES CHICKENS FOR EATING.THE EGG FARM USES A HYBRID RHODE ISLAND HEN AND ON AN AVERAGE 10,800 EGGS ARE LAID EVERY DAY COLLECTED, GRADED AND PACKED IN BOXES AND DISTRIBUTED TO PLACES AS FAR APART AS ABERDEEN AND PERTH.THEY ARE REARED IN A BATTERY SYSTEM.THE EGGS PRODUCED ARE KNOWN AS{"BARRY BROWN"}AND SELL VERY WELL AS HOUSEWIVES SEEM TO PREFER BROWN EGGS. THE OTHER INTENSIVE UNIT KEEPS CHICKENS FROM SEVERAL DAYS OLD,FEEDS THEM ON TURKEY PELLETS THEN AT EIGHT WEEKS THEY ARE READY TO BE KILLED FOR EATING.THEY ARE REARED IN A DEEP LITTER SYSTEM.AT ONE TIME 70,000 BIRDS MAY BE OCCUPY THE SHEDS.
